title: Can we maybe NOT remove the crit reduction from Omen?
body:
I would like {{champion:157}}  to have at least a little bit of counter play.

Thanks.

240% crit damage is not the end of the world when you get {{item:3036}} 15% bonus damage against them

I don't see why there needs to be more counterbuilding against the class thats supposed to counter tanks. Besides, Randuin's  is still a strong counter item due to the auto attack slows and Tabis is as strong as ever.

thats all

it doesn't become 240% crit damage. It reduces that damage from the whole thing by 10%. So if an adc has ie and has 100 ad, he will do 250 damage if they don't have randuins (assuming armor doesn't exist). If the enemy has randuins they will do 250 - .10 x 250= 250-25= 225 damage.

Still, using that same logic and math, 225% damage gets amped back up to 225 + .15 x 225 = 225 + 33.75 = 258.75

Point being that even with a crit damage reduction item, which is also relatively expensive for a tank item, ADCs are still going to deal plenty of damage.
i was just explaining how the math worked

Other than Vayne, no Tank cares whther or not an ADC has crit. Who do you think is going to win in a 1v1, Fucking Caitlyn or Nautilus?

ADC's exist because of their high overall damage and how fast they can push, they do NOT exist to kill tanks, other than Juggernauts, no class by itself can truly 1v1 a tank.

ADCs, as opposed to assassins or mages are supposed to be the guys that scale better with items, that's why you give them a whole lane and a nanny, and a second nanny with smite so they can get their gold. So, when the ADC finally gets his items, they absolutely stomp over anything that can't kill them fast enough, like tanks.

Like this {{item:3072}}. Nautilus has a single knockup, the rest are roots and slows so she can keep firing during those. And he deals less damage than she heals up. She can literally sit there shooting at his inefficient ass (Seriously, that build has very little HP) and healing up the damage he deals.

Now, if it was a fighter, an assassin or a mage it'd be a different story, but a tank? pfft, ADCs are made to eat those alive. Lifesteal exists precisely so ADCs eat tanks whole in any circumstance. Which is great because aside from ADCs and some fighters, most people wouldn't stand a chance against a full-item tank.

No, we don't.
What's funny enough is that no one even bought Randuin's when faced against a crit champion, even as a tank. So what's this about "i need counterplay items" when no one even thinks about counterplay, when no one even itemizes against their matchup accordingly?

>Randuin's is possibly too weak in this version, though it still is the strongest of the HP/Armor items defensively, and has the lowest price point. As mentioned very briefly, there are some possible change to penetration coming that perhaps will help with this concern.

>One thing I didn't get into in the main post (but am happy to here) is that the removal of Crit Damage Reduction from Randuin's is intended to head off and/or defuse some power creep in the shop, especially since crit users are generally supposed to be successful at dealing damage to tanks. Some of these changes may result in outlier champions that have special crit interactions, and in that case, we'll need to address those case by case.

because tanks aren't supposed to be raid bosses who can survive against a fully dedicated mixed damage team that builds armor pen and has %hp magic damage for like 10 seconds

If they can't survive for an extended amount of time, they can't do anything.  The tank role is not mean to go in and die for the cause.  It's mean to go in, survive, and disrupt.  You can't disrupt if you're dead.  You can't deal damage because you built full tank.  Basically, if you can't survive extended periods under heavy damage, your team is playing a 4v5.

This is why riot recently mentioned they're looking at armor pen stats along with the reworks.

but full tanks still have lots of damage in their bases and in the fact that a lot of them have %hp damage

current tanks still distrupt but with cc. they shouldn't be able to just sit on your team for like 10 seconds. if they can then they should have their base damages and %hp damages removed.

If you die because you let {{champion:154}} sit on top of you for 10 seconds to kill you with his W, you deserve to die because you were out of position OR your team deserves to lose because no one peeled the zac after the engage.  I use zac as the example because he has %health damage and people whine about him a lot.  Btw, say an adc (because adcs complain the most about tanks) has 2k health at level 18.  zac's %health ability is  dealing 260 damage to you before resistances which he basically has to be standing on top of you to deal.  The only chance zac has to outright kill anyone as full tank is if he lands the E, hits all the bounces on his ult on them, never lets them get out of range of his W, and nails the Q and even then he'll still likely have to hit at least one more E.  This whole initial rotation happens over the course of 5 seconds at which point anyone could have CCed him to peel.  After that he can only jump in (with a telegraphed skill shot that gives an indicator of where he's landing) once every 7 seconds.  Most full tank champions follow a similar pattern of slow damage, being kited, and reengaging.

Simply put, tanks aren't actually the ones killing you.  They're just the ones punishing you when you get out of position aka engaging intelligently.  

Whats that?  You're in the back line and still got nailed by the zac E?  This is when we look at adc kits and I ask you "why didn't you punish it?"  
Caitlin- drop a trap where he's going to lane and E away.
Tristana- jump away, R him into your tank
Jinx drop chompers and take a little damage and walk away
vayne- tumble away, potentially into a condemn
lucian- dash away and ult him
draven- CC him mid jump, take no damage and kill him
kallista- autoattack kite him
miss fortune- E take a little damage and sprint away
Kog Maw- Die unless you get peel over the next 8 seconds or are fed enough to just kill him anyway.
Ashe- arrow and kite with built in slows
twitch- Take some damage, go invisible and walk away
Varus-pray you have flash up

For good measure I will also include the following:
Graves- basically a bruiser, builds maw, and has a dash. He's fine.
Quinn- take some damage, vault away and punish zac.
Teemo- you drop a mushroom and die you piece of shit. good riddance.  
Mages- zhonyas and walk away basically for free after your team CCs him down.

So unless you are playing varus, teemo, or kog maw, you've got a way to deal with tank engage.
BTW Kog can probably facetank a Zac anytime after 4 items. Unless it's full AP Zac. But then he's an Assassin. And a bad-ish one at that.

You're thinking of raid bosses, not tanks.

Most of the times, they can't even finish them because they waited too long.
